image.altText: An overhead shot of a bus on its side.

items.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says the "mental scars will not go away" for those involved in a fatal bus crash after a wedding at Wandin Valley Estate. Follow live.

title.children: Police describe 'very traumatic scene' after Hunter Valley bus crash as number of injured rises to 25

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is giving a statement from Canberra. "All of us know the joy of going to a wedding, a chance to celebrate dear friends and family," he says. "They are some of the happiest times that you can have. "For a joyous day like that, in a beautiful place, to end with such terrible loss of life and injury is so cruel and so sad and so unfair."
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: PM says crash is 'cruel and unfair'

children.content: Prime Minister
Anthony Albanese
is giving a statement from Canberra.
"All of us know the joy of going to a wedding, a chance to celebrate dear friends and family," he says.
"They are some of the happiest times that you can have.
"For a joyous day like that, in a beautiful place, to end with such terrible loss of life and injury is so cruel and so sad and so unfair."

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The bus passengers were travelling from a wedding at Wandin Valley Estate to their accommodation when the fatal crash took place. The estate has issued a statement, saying the wedding venue will be closed today: " We are deeply saddened to hear of the bus crash overnight that has claimed the lives of some of our guests," the statement said. "Our heartfelt condolences go out to the family and friends of the victims and we are supporting them in any way we can. "At this time, we are providing support to those who need our help and we wish to maintain their privacy and won't be making further statements."
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: The wedding venue of the crash victims will be closed today

children.content: The bus passengers were travelling from a wedding at
Wandin Valley Estate
to their accommodation when the fatal crash took place.
The estate has issued a statement, saying the wedding venue will be closed today:
We are deeply saddened
to hear of the bus crash overnight that has claimed the lives of some of our guests," the statement said.
"Our heartfelt condolences go out to the family and friends of the victims and
we are supporting them in any way we can.
"At this time, we are providing support to those who need our help and
we wish to maintain their privacy
and won't be making further statements."

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The police update from Assistant Commissioner Tracy Chapman has wrapped up. Here's a recap of what we learnt: 10 people are dead and 25 others injured after a coach overturned at a roundabout in a single vehicle collision on Wine Country Rd near Greta A 58-year-old bus driver is now under arrest at Cessnock police station and a crime scene has been established Those taken to various hospitals have "varying injuries" while the bodies of the deceased have not been removed from the site While police didn't reveal the ages of those involved, they confirmed no children were on board at the time
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: What we learnt from the police update

children.content: The police update from Assistant Commissioner Tracy Chapman has wrapped up. Here's a recap of what we learnt:
10 people are dead and 25 others injured after a coach overturned at a roundabout in a single vehicle collision on Wine Country Rd near Greta
A 58-year-old bus driver is now under arrest at Cessnock police station and a crime scene has been established
Those taken to various hospitals have "varying injuries" while the bodies of the deceased have not been removed from the site
While police didn't reveal the ages of those involved, they confirmed no children were on board at the time

image.altText: Bus In Day Still Down

items.synopsis: Ten people have died and multiple others have been injured in a bus crash in the NSW Hunter Valley, with emergency services called to Wine Country Drive at Greta just after 11.30pm on Sunday.

title.children: Driver arrested after 10 people die in Hunter Valley wedding bus crash

image.altText: A dark, blue-lit photo shows a bus lying on its side and an emergency services worker.

items.synopsis: Forensic and traffic police are piecing together the events of a fatal bus crash in NSW's Hunter Valley, which has claimed the lives of at least 10 wedding-goers.

title.children: What we know about the fatal Hunter Valley wedding bus crash

image.altText: a man sitting on a balcony holding a cup and looking at the camera

items.synopsis: Joseph Markov fled his home with just his walking stick as the flames destroyed the neighbouring historic building in Surry Hills. He fears he is weeks away from being able to return home.

title.children: Joseph has stayed in six hotels since the Sydney fire, he still doesn't know when he can return home

image.altText: The back of a man sitting on a folding chair on the sideline of a soccer game. Players can be seen in the distance.

items.synopsis: Australian soccer's governing body is taking a cut from every local bet placed on games at all levels, including amateur suburban competitions.

title.children: The man on the sidelines helping punters around the world bet on this suburban soccer game

image.altText: Donald Trump in blue suit and red tie speaking at podium with US flag in the background.

items.synopsis: Former US attorney-general William Barr says Donald Trump is "toast" if allegations that he wilfully retained hundreds of highly classified documents are proven true under Special Counsel Jack Smith's 37-count indictment against the former president.

title.children: Donald Trump's former attorney-general says 'he's toast' if indictment allegations are true

image.altText: A young girl's hand over an elderly man's hand sitting on the arm of a chair.

items.synopsis: The Illawarra Shoalhaven Local Health District has the most patients waiting in hospital to be transferred to aged care as a growing number of homes close their doors.

title.children: Aged care closures trigger hospital 'bed crisis' as operators blame funding, staff shortages

image.altText: Composite image of Shellie Morris, Astrid Jorgenson, Tim Winton and Barry Humphries.

items.synopsis: Prominent Australians including author Tim Winton and late comedian Barry Humphries are appointed to the Order of Australia, in the first year women outnumber men on the honours list.

title.children: 'Life's great, I love it': The passionate Australians being honoured this King's Birthday

image.altText: A group of Australian men's cricketers cheer for the camera as the captain holds a large golden mace.

items.synopsis: Seven weeks after their World Test Championship victory, Australia hope to be back at The Oval celebrating "legacy-defining stuff" as Ashes victors.

title.children: After the mace, we want legacy-defining Ashes urn, says triumphant captain Pat Cummins

image.altText: A blurred image from high of a crowd of people.

items.synopsis: A lack of data on how consumers are responding to monetary policy could lead the Reserve Bank to raise rates into a recession. And what if that's difficult to escape? It's a critical economic question right now, writes David Taylor.

title.children: The economy is in a race to the bottom and nobody wants to win

image.altText: Emergency services park alongside a grass field

items.synopsis: A two-vehicle crash in regional NSW which killed a 36-year-old mother and left a man in a critical condition is being treated by police as a domestic-related incident.

title.children: Fatal crash in Molong treated as domestic-related incident by police as community mourns

image.altText: ambulances on a street attend to a shooting

items.synopsis: A man believed to be aged in his 40s has been found with gunshot wounds at Factory Street in Granville.

title.children: Man fatally shot in Sydney's west, prompting NSW Police investigation

image.altText: The outline of four women, kept anonymous, superimposed over shattered glass

items.synopsis: The deaths of four Aboriginal women in the Northern Territory briefly captured headlines. But years after their deaths, the coroner is about to examine each of their tragic stories in depth.

title.children: Coroner examining deaths of four Aboriginal women warns evidence will be 'shocking'

image.altText: A sign outside Banksia Hill Detention Centre with a police officer nearby.

items.synopsis: The WA Department of Justice is accused of intimidating and bullying staff who speak about Western Australia's juvenile detention facilities, including by warning them about possible jail time.

title.children: 'Cease immediately': Leaked email shows warning to Banksia Hill officers over workplace conversations

image.altText: Bluey holds a cricket ball next to her dad, Bandit.

items.synopsis: The new Bluey episode, cricket, is a perfect homage to the backyard game, and an example to never give up in pursuit of your dreams.

title.children: Bluey's ode to backyard cricket a perfect lesson on what the game is about

image.altText: Tennis star Novak Djokovic smiles as he holds the French Open trophy while wearing a jacket with "23" on it.

items.synopsis: Novak Djokovic breaks more tennis records with a defeat of Casper Ruud to win his 23rd grand slam title at the French Open.

title.children: Novak Djokovic makes history at French Open, wins record 23rd men's grand slam title

image.altText: Richmond Tigers player Marlion Pickett celebrates grand final win holding up cup smiling in front of crowd

items.synopsis: In a statement, Richmond Football Club said the alleged offences occurred in December 2022 and January 2023.

title.children: Richmond Tigers AFL player Marlion Pickett arrested for alleged burglary

image.altText: Woman with dark hair and dark glasses in a red jumper. There is a lamp behind her. She is facing us but looking to the right.

items.synopsis: Kerry has seen three family members battle motor neurone disease. But she's hopeful for a cure  and experts are on her side.

title.children: Kerry lost her daughter and ex-husband to MND. Now, her son is living with the condition

image.altText: A marijuna plant.

items.synopsis: Bureau of Crime Statistics and Research findings suggest the NSW Cannabis Caution Scheme has "indirect bias" built into its eligibility criteria.

title.children: Claims of police bias as study finds Aboriginal adults caught with cannabis more likely to be charged

image.altText: A police officer stands in front of two Australian flags.

items.synopsis: WA Police say they are mourning the death of 28-year-old Constable Anthony Woods, who has died after being run over while trying to make an arrest following a police pursuit.

title.children: WA Police officer dies after being run over in line of duty

image.altText: CCTV man in red shirt in front of 4WD

items.synopsis: Jeremiah Rivers vanished in south-west Queensland in a case that's baffled detectives and left family and friends, across remote Western Australia, heartbroken.

title.children: Inquest to probe WA man's disappearance during outback pig-hunting trip

image.altText: Spain clams

items.synopsis: Clam collecting in the expansive inlets of Spain's north-western region of Galicia is a deep-rooted tradition handed down from generation to generation, with the workers predominantly women.

title.children: Meet Spain's 'peasant farmers of the sea', the women who spend their days digging for clams

image.altText: A man walks while smoke rises above buildings after aerial bombardment

items.synopsis: Heavy clashes and artillery fire erupts across Sudan's capital Khartoum on Sunday and residents report air strikes soon after the end of a 24-hour ceasefire.

title.children: Heavy clashes erupt across Sudan's capital after 24-hour truce expires

image.altText: Dalai Lama

items.synopsis: Tibetan Buddhists may face a future of duelling Dalai Lamas: one born in exile who will receive traditional religious training, the other a mouthpiece of the Communist Party, writes John Powers.

title.children: China's prepared for battle over the Dalai Lama's reincarnation — and survival is at stake

image.altText: RBA governor Philip Lowe speaks at the Morgan Stanley Australia summit in Sydney

items.synopsis: The recent increase in the minimum wage was the start of an important shift in wage-setting, writes Gareth Hutchens.

title.children: Was the minimum wage increase inflationary? There's a far bigger issue at stake for workers

image.altText: A woman holds a open palmed hand partially in front of her face.

items.synopsis: Former Scottish first minister Nicola Sturgeon has been arrested and held for more than seven hours on Sunday after voluntarily attending an interview over a police probe into the fate of funds for her pro-independence Scottish National Party.

title.children: Scottish ex-leader Nicola Sturgeon released after arrest by police in party finance probe

image.altText: Hillsong Colour Conference 2019

items.synopsis: The downfall of Hillsong – one of Australia's biggest exports after iron ore and the Hemsworth brothers – has led to serious soul-searching.

title.children: The rise and fall of Hillsong – and what it means for the Pentecostal church movement in Australia

image.altText: Australian banknotes, mostly $50 bills, strewn over a flat surface.

items.synopsis: Almost 5 million Australians claimed work from home expenses last financial year, but the ATO has changed the methods you can use to claim tax deductions this tax time. Landlords renting out property and crypto investors are also under focus.

title.children: The ATO's changed the methods you can use to claim tax deductions for working from home

image.altText: Woman stands next to a white ute, brown boder collie dogs sits in the tray.

items.synopsis: After five fatal dog attacks in the past year, these Wheatbelt farmers are pleading with pet owners to do more to protect livestock in the region.

title.children: 'Animals are found alive that shouldn't be' after dog attacks

image.altText: US highway collapse

items.synopsis: A portion of a major US highway collapsed in Philadelphia after a vehicle caught fire underneath it, city officials say.

title.children: US highway collapses in Philadelphia after vehicle engulfed by fire

image.altText: Two you women stand in an alley holding vegetables

items.synopsis: Food waste is a big issue, especially when there is a cost-of-living crisis. And while "dumpster diving" is not encouraged, with strict guidelines, it is one of the ways Tasmanian volunteers are helping to keep people fed.

title.children: These women don't want good food wasted so even 'dumpster diving' is on the menu — to a point
